definitions: in or to a place that is not inside building
beyond the limits or scope of something
examples: Let's go outside for some fresh air
The children are playing outside in yard
That's outside my area of expertise unfortunately
This falls outside our budget constraints completely

definitions: after noon; in the afternoon or evening hours
examples: The meeting is scheduled for 3 pm
I'll arrive at 7 pm tonight

definitions: finally; in the end after everything is considered
at the most basic or fundamental level
examples: She ultimately decided to accept the offer
The project ultimately succeeded despite many challenges
Ultimately, it's a question of personal values
All decisions ultimately rest with the board

definitions: it is regrettable that; expressing disappointment about situation
examples: Unfortunately, I can't attend the party tonight
The weather was unfortunately too bad for hiking

definitions: completely; wholly with nothing left out or excepted
examples: I entirely agree with your decision here
The story is entirely fictional, not real

definitions: in a precise and exact way; particularly
examples: I specifically asked for no onions please
This rule applies specifically to new employees

definitions: however; despite that fact; nevertheless
examples: It's expensive though worth every penny spent
I'm tired; I'll come though, don't worry

definitions: after the expected, usual, or proper time
recently; in the recent past
examples: She arrived late to the meeting today
Don't stay up too late tonight please
I've been feeling tired of late
These problems started appearing late last year

definitions: not one nor the other of two things
examples: Neither option seems good to me honestly
I can neither confirm nor deny that

definitions: extending or directly below something; beneath
less than a particular amount or level
examples: The cat is hiding under the bed
Look under the table for your keys
Children under 12 get in free today
The temperature is under freezing this morning

definitions: in a sufficiently great way to be important or notable
examples: Sales have increased significantly this quarter impressively
The new method is significantly faster than before

definitions: to a great extent; mostly or mainly
examples: The project was largely successful despite some issues
This is largely due to increased demand

definitions: in or to all places; in every place
examples: I've looked everywhere for my missing keys
There were flowers everywhere in the garden

definitions: to an increasing extent; more and more
examples: It's becoming increasingly difficult to find parking
People are increasingly working from home nowadays

definitions: as a necessary result; inevitably in all cases
examples: More expensive doesn't necessarily mean better quality
Success doesn't necessarily bring happiness to everyone

definitions: at an earlier time; before the present time
examples: I had previously worked in marketing department
As previously mentioned, we need more funding

definitions: only just; barely or scarcely able to
used to emphasize that something is not true
examples: I can hardly hear you over the noise
She had hardly finished when he arrived
That's hardly fair to the other students
I hardly think that's the real problem

definitions: by oneself rather than through another person
speaking from one's own opinion or feelings
examples: I'll deliver the message personally tomorrow morning
She personally oversees all major projects here
Personally, I think it's a bad idea
I don't take it personally when criticized

definitions: in a way that avoids harm or mistakes attentively
examples: Drive carefully on the icy roads tonight
She carefully examined all the evidence presented

definitions: forward in time, place, or order; onward
out from a starting point; into view
examples: From that day forth, everything changed completely
Go forth and spread the good news
The plants burst forth in spring bloom
He set forth his ideas clearly yesterday

definitions: during the same time; while something else happens
examples: Cook the pasta; meanwhile, prepare the sauce
She studied law; meanwhile, he pursued medicine

definitions: only just; by the smallest margin possible
examples: I barely made it to work on time
She could barely contain her excitement today

definitions: separated by distance or time interval
into pieces or parts; in a separated state
examples: The two cities are 50 miles apart
Keep the chemicals apart for safety reasons
The old chair fell apart yesterday evening
Take the engine apart to repair it

definitions: to some extent but not completely; partly
examples: The delay was part my fault admittedly
It's part business, part pleasure this trip

definitions: probably; having a good chance of happening
examples: It will likely rain tomorrow afternoon unfortunately
She's likely to win the competition easily

definitions: in most cases; usually as a normal pattern
examples: I typically wake up at 6 am
Summer here typically lasts three months long

definitions: only; and nothing more; simply
examples: I was merely asking a question politely
It's merely a suggestion, not a requirement

definitions: to a moderate extent or degree; rather
examples: I'm somewhat confused by your explanation honestly
The results were somewhat disappointing this time

definitions: to or on one side; out of the way
apart from; except for
examples: Step aside and let them pass through
Put your worries aside for now please
Aside from the cost, it's a good plan
Aside from John, everyone attended the meeting

definitions: often; many times at short intervals regularly
examples: She frequently travels for business purposes nowadays
This problem occurs frequently with older computers

definitions: at or toward the back of something
late or slow in progress or development
examples: Look behind you before backing up carefully
The sun disappeared behind the clouds
We're behind schedule on this project unfortunately
She's behind in her rent payments again

definitions: connected to or available through the internet
examples: I prefer shopping online for convenience nowadays
The course is available online starting tomorrow

definitions: in a literal manner; exactly as stated
used for emphasis while not being literally true
examples: The word literally means 'by the letter'
Follow the instructions literally without any deviation
I literally died laughing at that joke
There were literally thousands of people there

definitions: in a perfect manner; without any flaws completely
examples: The dress fits perfectly after the alterations
I understand perfectly what you mean now

definitions: at any or every time that; no matter when
examples: Call me whenever you need help urgently
Whenever it rains, the roof leaks badly

definitions: in essence; at the most basic or fundamental level
examples: The two proposals are essentially the same
It's essentially a question of trust here

definitions: far down from the surface or edge
very intensely or to a profound degree
examples: Breathe deeply to relax your mind completely
The roots grow deeply into the soil
She was deeply moved by his speech
I deeply regret my actions yesterday evening

definitions: to a moderate degree; quite but not very
in a fair and just manner; impartially
examples: The test was fairly easy this time
She's fairly certain about her decision
Treat all employees fairly without any bias
The prize was fairly distributed among winners

definitions: before all others in time or order
before doing anything else; initially
examples: She arrived first at the meeting today
First come, first served at this restaurant
First, let me explain the basic concept
I want to thank you first of all

definitions: in a position near to something; tightly
in a careful and attentive way
examples: Stand closely together for the photo please
The houses are built closely to each other
Watch closely as I demonstrate this technique
We're monitoring the situation closely every day

definitions: without being affected by any other consideration
examples: We'll continue regardless of the weather conditions
She's determined to succeed regardless of obstacles

definitions: certainly; without doubt it must be true
used to express surprise that something is not so
examples: She'll surely win the race today easily
This will surely solve our problem completely
Surely you don't believe that story?
Surely there must be another way?

definitions: continuously over a period of time; always happening
examples: The baby cries constantly throughout the night
Technology is constantly changing our lives dramatically

definitions: for the most part; mainly or chiefly
examples: The company focuses primarily on software development
This tool is primarily used for cutting metal

definitions: as a whole; generally speaking without specific details
examples: In general, people prefer sunny weather overall
The general opinion supports this new policy

definitions: over a large area or range; extensively
by many people; commonly or generally
examples: The news spread widely across social media
These plants are widely distributed in Asia
This view is widely held among experts
Her work is widely admired internationally today

definitions: roughly; more or less but not exactly
examples: The journey takes approximately two hours driving
There were approximately 100 people attending yesterday

definitions: in, at, or to another place or other places
examples: If you can't find it here, look elsewhere
She decided to seek employment elsewhere instead

definitions: with great strength or force physically
to a great degree; very much intensely
examples: Hold the rope strongly with both hands
The wind blew strongly all night long
I strongly disagree with that statement completely
She strongly believes in equal rights everywhere

definitions: not often; seldom occurring or happening infrequently
examples: She rarely goes out on weekday evenings
Snow rarely falls in this region nowadays
